content.description:
Hobbit Heart is unassuming in appearance, but the movement is actually pretty interesting and challenging.

Sit start with hands matched on the good undercling. From there, stick the lip, toe hook the start hold, match hands, throw a heel up, crank up to the bumps, work the sidepull and press it out to the large imprint, drink your tea, and finish up the remaining featured slab.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work fine. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Troll Tip.

climbs.name: Comparison Is the Thief of Joy

content.description:
Sit start with a high left hand edge at the arete's elbow and a right hand sidepull low on the face. From there, stick the lip, walk the feet over to a heel hook, and follow the fin up and left to mantel onto the slab and an easy finish.

A classier start would involve starting with a left hand lower on the arete. That was beyond my strength today though.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the east side of the boulder's southeast arete.
